page.title: 15Windmill Hill
page.content: Windmill Hill was already so named in the eighteenth century. It was probably the site of a timber post mill. This, in turn, may have been erected on an ancient burial mound similar to the "Toot" in West Bradley. The name "Baltonsborough" probably refers to such a "barrow" and Wind- mill Hill, the highest point in the parish, is a likely location for such a barrow. Remains of a supposedly medieval tunnel, 4' wide and 6' high, with a barrel roof and partially paved floor have been found on the west side.
